avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche danger is moderate above 2200m, below that altitude danger is low. Medium-sized slab avalanches can be triggered by one sole skier in a few steep spots above 2200m. If a fracture occurs it can reach down to more deeply embedded layers in the snowpack and the release grow to medium size. The danger zones are difficult to recognize, occur esp. on very steep W/N facing slopes. Caution urged esp. at entry points into very steep gullies and bowls. During the course of the day, naturally triggered loose-snow avalanches can be expected in extremely steep south-facing terrain. On steep grass-covered slopes, isolated small glide-snow avalanches are possible in isolated cases.
avalancheActivity.highlights: On very steep N/W facing slopes, assess with caution the weak old snow. Fresh drifts are prone to triggering over small areas.

snowpackStructure.comment: The 5-15 cm of fresh snow/graupel from the last 24 hrs has been transported by northerly winds, including the often well consolidated and moistened (above 2400m) fresh snow from last week (30-60cm). On very steep shady slopes at high altitudes, this snow was deposited atop faceted, expansively metamorphosed snow. Due to massive settling on Saturday, the sink-in depth in all aspects is low (5-20cm).

tendency.highlights: Likelihood of snowdrift accumulations triggering will gradually diminish

weatherForecast.comment: On Tuesday, superb backcountry touring weather with brilliant sunshine and outstanding visibility. Easterly winds will be light to moderate, along the Tauern also from the south. On the summits of the Northern Alps, brisk and cold easterly winds will be blowing. Temperatures will rise. At 2000m. from -11 to -3 degrees; at 3000m. from -16 to -7 degrees.

Medium-sized slab avalanches can be triggered by one sole skier in a few steep spots above 2200m. If a fracture occurs it can reach down to more deeply embedded layers in the snowpack and the release grow to medium size. The danger zones are difficult to recognize, occur esp. on very steep W/N facing slopes. Caution urged esp. at entry points into very steep gullies and bowls. During the course of the day, naturally triggered loose-snow avalanches can be expected in extremely steep south-facing terrain. On steep grass-covered slopes, isolated small glide-snow avalanches are possible in isolated cases.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Caution: fresh drifts are trigger-sensitive over small areas. On very steep N/W facing slopes, weak layers require cautious assessment.

snowpackStructure.comment: The 5-15 cm of fresh snow/graupel from the last 24 hrs has been transported by northerly winds, including the often well consolidated and moistened (above 2400m) fresh snow from last week (30-60cm). On very steep shady slopes at high altitudes, this snow was deposited atop faceted, expansively metamorphosed snow. Due to massive settling on Saturday, the sink-in depth in all aspects is low (5-20cm).

weatherForecast.comment: On Tuesday, superb backcountry touring weather with brilliant sunshine and outstanding visibility. Easterly winds will be light to moderate, along the Tauern also from the south. On the summits of the Northern Alps, brisk and cold easterly winds will be blowing. Temperatures will rise. At 2000m. from -11 to -3 degrees; at 3000m. from -16 to -7 degrees.

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche danger is low. Isolated small loose-snow naturally triggered avalanches are possible or can be triggered by one sole skier. Danger zones for small slab avalanches in the snowdrifts occur seldom on very steep N/E facing slopes at high altitudes. On steep grass-covered slopes, isolated small glide-snow avalanches are possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Danger of falling outweighs that of being buried in snow masses

snowpackStructure.comment: The shallow, generally stable snowpack has consolidated well. About 5-10cm of fresh snow lies atop a melt-freeze crust mostly capable-of-bearing-loads.

weatherForecast.comment: On Tuesday, superb backcountry touring weather with brilliant sunshine and outstanding visibility. Easterly winds will be light to moderate, along the Tauern also from the south. On the summits of the Northern Alps, brisk and cold easterly winds will be blowing. Temperatures will rise. At 2000m. from -11 to -3 degrees; at 3000m. from -16 to -7 degrees. Nighttime skies on Tuesday night will be clear and have only light winds.

customData.generalHeadline: On very steep N/W facing slopes, assess with caution the weak old snow. Fresh drifts are prone to triggering over small areas.
